sections.heading: Data Source and Accuracy
content: This App displays published nutrition data in an easy-to-understand format. It presents nutritional information from multiple published references and official data sources. The App does not provide medical, dietary, or nutritional advice.

The information provided is for informational purposes only and should not replace professional medical advice. For any dietary decisions or health concerns, consult a qualified healthcare professional or registered dietitian.
About the Data

This App presents nutritional information drawn from multiple published references and official data sources. While care has been taken in collecting and displaying this information, errors may occur during translation or display. While great care has been taken to maintain accuracy, occasional errors or discrepancies may still occur.

All nutrient values are expressed per 100g of food (or per 100ml for alcoholic beverages) for easy comparison. The data is derived from analytical surveys, literature sources, calculated values, and manufacturer data.

Nutrient values in published datasets represent typical averages and may not reflect every food item, brand, or preparation method. Due to natural variability in foods, the values published should be regarded as typical rather than definitive. A particular food item is unlikely to have precisely the same composition as given in these tables, especially for unprocessed foods such as cereals, dairy products, eggs, meat, fish, fruit and vegetables.

Because the App performs calculations, conversions, and classification steps, there is a small possibility of translation or processing errors. The values shown may have been processed, reformatted, or converted for use within the App. For critical use, always verify values with the original published sources. If you rely on a particular value for medical, dietary, or specialist purposes, always verify values with the original published sources. For sensitive or clinical use, primary sources should always be considered authoritative.
For Sensitive Groups and Special Dietary Requirements
For specific dietary requirements, sensitive age groups, or medically-restricted nutritional needs, consult a qualified healthcare professional or registered dietitian.
If you have specific dietary requirements, are in a sensitive age group (very young or elderly), or have medically-restricted nutritional needs, we strongly advise that you:
1. Consult a qualified healthcare professional or registered dietitian before making dietary decisions based on information in this App.
2. Verify any critical nutritional values directly with the original published source material.
Reporting Issues

If you notice any inconsistencies between the App and a published reference, please report them using "Report a Problem" so we can investigate and correct them. If you notice any inconsistencies, please report them using "Report a Problem".

sections.heading: Daily Reference Values
content: The daily reference values shown in this App are published reference values from authoritative sources (UK, US, EU). These are reference values, not dietary recommendations.

The App allows you to access published daily reference values based on your profile. These are published reference values, not dietary recommendations. Individual nutritional needs may vary based on health conditions, activity levels, and other factors.
Custom Daily Reference Values

The App includes features that allow you to customise daily reference values and nutrient thresholds. Individual nutrient settings should only be modified with advice from a qualified healthcare professional or registered dietitian.

Changing DRVs or thresholds without proper guidance could lead to misinterpretation of nutrient values and may not align with your health needs. Always consult a medical professional before making significant changes to nutrient reference values. If you choose to set a custom DRV for any nutrient, please do so only with guidance from a qualified healthcare professional.

sections.heading: Data Sources and Attribution
content: Primary Data Source

The primary nutritional data in this App is sourced from McCance and Widdowson's The Composition of Foods Integrated Dataset (CoFID) 2021, maintained by Public Health England (at the time of publication). This dataset is provided under the Open Government Licence v3.0.
The nutritional data in this application has not been modified or changed in any way and is exactly the same as the original source data from CoFID 2021.
Source URL: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/composition-of-foods-integrated-dataset-cofid
Additional Reference Sources
The App also references daily reference values from:
<ul class="list-disc list-outside mb-4 space-y-1 pl-5">
• UK: Department of Health Dietary Reference Values
• US: Dietary Reference Intakes from the National Academies
• EU: Reference Intakes from EU Regulation
• Average: Calculated average of UK and US values
